content:
Meal planning is a great habit! I'd be happy to help you with some quick and healthy dinner ideas that incorporate leftover rice. Here are a few options:

1. **Rice Bowl with Grilled Chicken and Veggies**: Marinate chicken breast in your favorite seasonings and grill it for 5-6 minutes per side. Serve with leftover rice, roasted veggies (like broccoli, carrots, and bell peppers), and a drizzle of your favorite sauce.
2. **Rice and Lentil Bowl with Spinach and Feta**: Cook lentils according to package instructions, then mix with leftover rice, wilted spinach, and crumbled feta cheese. Add a squeeze of lemon juice and a sprinkle of red pepper flakes for extra flavor.
3. **Korean-Style Rice and Veggie Stir-Fry**: Heat some oil in a wok or large skillet and sauté your favorite veggies (like bell peppers, onions, and mushrooms) with some garlic and ginger. Add cooked rice, soy sauce, and a fried egg on top.
4. **Rice and Black Bean Tacos**: Mix cooked black beans with diced tomatoes, chopped cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice. Serve with leftover rice, taco shells, and your favorite toppings like avocado, sour cream, and salsa.
5. **Rice and Shrimp Stir-Fry with Snow Peas**: Cook shrimp in a wok or skillet with some oil, garlic, and ginger. Add snow peas, cooked rice, and a splash of soy sauce. Serve with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.
6. **Rice and Roasted Veggie Wrap**: Fill a whole wheat tortilla with leftover rice, roasted veggies (like zucchini, eggplant, and red bell peppers), and a dollop of hummus or tzatziki sauce.

These ideas should take no more than 30-40 minutes to prepare and cook. You can also customize them to your taste preferences and dietary needs.

What do you think? Do any of these ideas inspire you to create a delicious and quick dinner using your leftover rice?
